member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.MessageType
member.summary: Enumeration of the various message types that are supported.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.MessageStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of the various status values a message may have. Only applies to outgoing messages

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.MessageReplaceSet
member.summary: Enumeration of settings for replacing SMS messages in Inbox.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.PositionRequestStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of the various status values a position request may have. Applies only to incoming messages with positioning enabled og Gateway.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message
member.summary: A Message object holds all the settings and values of an SMS message. This class is used both for incoming outgoing messages, but not all properties are valid for incoming messages.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.RequestReceipt
member.summary: Set to true to request a receipt (Delivery Report) for this message. The delivery report will either be available on the account web or forwarded to your application depending on your account settings on the SMS Gateway.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.MessageClass
member.summary: Use the MessageClass property to send Flash messages by setting it to 0 (zero). A Flash message is displayed immediately on the receivers handset. Default MessageClass is 2.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Text
member.summary: The message/text to be sent. One SMS can be up to 160 characters long. If the text is longer, it will be divided into several SMS messages by the Gateway and delivered and a concatinated SMS to the receivers handset. When MessageType is a binary type, then this property holds the hexadecimal string representation of the binary message.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.ReceiverNumber
member.summary: The number of the receiver. The number must be an internationally formatted number. That is a number that includes country prefix. Any spaces or leading "00" and "+" will be removed and should thus be avoided.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.SenderNumber
member.summary: The number or id of the sender. This should either be an internationally formatted number like the ReceiverNumber or an alphanumeric string of up to 11 characters. Please note that no special characters are allowed, only 7 bit ASCII.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.MessageType
member.summary: The type of message to be sent. The MessageType enumeration holds the various types that are supported. Default is Text.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Status
member.summary: Indicates the status of the message. The MessageStatus enumeration holds the various states that may occur. This property is read-only and is updated only as a result of a SendMessages() operation.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Reference
member.summary: If RequestReceipt is set to true and your Gateway account has been enabled for delivery report forwarding, then the Reference property will hold a unique Reference value for this particular message after successfully issuing a SendMessages() operation. This Reference value can later be used to correlate the Message with a Delivery Report received at a later time. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Network
member.summary: Can be set to indicate a specific routing of this message. Should only be used for sending of Premium SMS messages where specific routing is required. Other usage of this may result in the message not being delivered.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Tariff
member.summary: Indicated the Premium Price in cents/Ã¸rer for a message sent as a Premium SMS. This requires that the account has been enabled for CPA/Premium SMS usage.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.FailedReason
member.summary: If a message was not accepted by the SMS Gateway you may find a more specific reason for this by checking this property. It will be empty for successfully submitted messages. This property is read-only and is updated only as a result of a SendMessages() operation.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Address
member.summary: For incoming messages the Gateway may include information about the name and address of the person that is registered to the SenderNumber. This is a value-added feature that will require a separate agreement with PSWinCom.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.AgeLimit
member.summary: You may specify an age limit when sending Premium SMS messages. If you set this property to a value larger than 0 (zero), then the value will be matched against the age of the subscriber. The subscriber must then be at least the given age in order to receive the message.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.Position
member.summary: It is possible to enable positioning services on the Gateway for incoming messages. When this is enabled for a given keyword or access number, the Gateway will retrieve position data for the subscriber that sent the SMS. This property is read-only. This is a value-added feature that will require a separate agreement with PSWinCom.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.CPATag
member.summary: Premium SMS messages may have an additional description associated with itself. This value will be shown on the subscribers phone bill to help identify the service purchased. Please note that not all operators support this property, and it may be restrictions to how it is formatted. Pelase consult PSWinCom technical support if you intend to use this feature. Others should set it to null.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.TimeToLive
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes this message will be valid. The time is counted from the moment the message has been received and stored on PSWinCom Gateway. Set to 0 to use default value.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.MessageReplaceSet
member.summary: Specifies if the message should replace a previous message in the Inbox on the handset with same ReplaceSet and SenderNumber. Default is NoReplace.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.ShortCode
member.summary: Specifies a specific shortcode/accessnumber to use when sending this message. This is only valid and required for MTU CPA usage.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.DeferredDelivery
member.summary: Specifies if the message should be queued for delivery at a later time instead of being forwarded to operator immediately. When set to true, the DeliveryTime parameter must also be set.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.DeliveryTime
member.summary: When the DeferredDelivery parameter is set to true, the message will be queued for delivery at this given time. The DeliveryTime must be between now and 7 days ahead. If outside this interval, the message will be rejected. The delivery time must be given in CET time. The Gateway will queue the message for delivery until the given date and time occurs. However the accuracy of delivery will depend on traffic load and operator accessiblity at the time of delivery.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message.ServiceCode
member.summary: ServiceCode must be specified when the message is a Premium CPA Goods and Services (GAS) message. It is a 5-digit code specifying the type of service or goods that is being charged. It should only be used together with Tariff, and also requires a separate CPA GAS agreement with PSWinCom.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport
member.summary: A DeliveryReport object holds all the settings and values of a Delivery Report.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.State
member.summary: This property indicates the final state of the message as given by the Network operator. Typical values are: DELIVRD: Message was successfully delivered to destination. EXPIRED: Message validity period has expired. DELETED: Message has been deleted. UNDELIV: The SMS was undeliverable (not a valid number or no available route to destination). ACCEPTD: Message was accepted (i.e. has been manually read on behalf of the subscriber by customer service). UNKNOWN: No information of delivery status available. REJECTD: Message was rejected. FAILED: The SMS failed to be delivered because no operator accepted the message or due to internal Gateway error. The following status codes will apply specially for Premium messages: BARRED: The receiver number is barred/blocked/not in use. Do not retry message, and remove number from any subscriber list. BARREDT: The receiver number is temporarily blocked. May be an empty pre-paid account or a subscriber that has extended his credit limit. BARREDC: The receiver has blocked for Premium (CPA) messages. Send a non-Premium message to inform the customer about this BARREDA: The receiver could not receive the message because his/her age is below the specified AgeLimit. ZERO_BAL: The receiver has an empty prepaid account. INV_NET: Invalid network. Receiver number is not recognized by the target operator.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.ReceiverNumber
member.summary: The number of the receiver that the message was originally sent to.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.SenderNumber
member.summary: The sender number.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.Reference
member.summary: A unique reference value that corresponds to the Reference value from the Message object from the particular Message that this Delivery Report is related to.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.DeliveryReport.DeliveredDate
member.summary: The Date and Time when the message was delivered to the handset (in local SMSC time)

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.PositionResult
member.summary: The result of a position request.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.PositionResult.Status
member.summary: Indicates the status of the position request. It will either be Ok og Failed depending on if the Gateway was enable to retrieve the GSM Position information for the sender. Applies only to incoming messages.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.PositionResult.FailedReason
member.summary: If a message was not accepted by the SMS Gateway you may find a more specific reason for this by checking this property. It will be empty for successfully submitted messages. This property is read-only and is updated only as a result of a SendMessages() operation.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.PositionResult.PositionData
member.summary: The position data as a GSMPosition object. This will be null unless PositionRequestStatus equals Ok.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition
member.summary: Represents a geographical position/area as given by the GSM network

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.Longitude
member.summary: Weighted center of gravity (COG) of the area where the subscriber is located to. The value is in Degree decimal (sample: -2.43121)

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.Latitude
member.summary: Weighted center of gravity of the area where the subscriber is located to. The value is in Degree decimal (sample: 50.123732)

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.Radius
member.summary: The radius from the COG where the subscriber may probably be. Distance is given in meters. Will be set to -1 if not supported by the subsribers operator.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.County
member.summary: County name (Fylke)

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.Council
member.summary: Council name (Kommune)

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.CouncilNumber
member.summary: Council number (Kommunenummer), a 4 digit code. Will be set to -1 if not supported by the subsribers operator.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.Place
member.summary: Place-name of the area where the subscriber is located to.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.SubPlace
member.summary: An optional specification of a more precise sub-area.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.ZipCode
member.summary: Zip-code of the area where the subscriber is located to. Will be set to -1 if not supported by the subsribers operator.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.GSMPosition.City
member.summary: Name of the City/town where the subscriber is located to.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ConnectionReceivedHandler
member.summary: Delegate for ConnectionReceived event

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket
member.summary: ServerSocket is a simple asynchronous Socket Server that can be configured to listen for incoming connections on a given port. New connections generates an Event suitable for use with the SMSClient for handling incoming messages and delivery reports.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.StartListening
member.summary: Initiate listening on chosen local port. This is a non-blocking operation, and the socket will keep listening until StopListening() is called. Each new connection will generate ConnectionReceived events.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.StopListening
member.summary: Terminate the listening.

member.name: E:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: This event is fired whenever a connection is established on the port that the socket server is listening on. The event has two parameters, one input stream and one output stream. They should be used directly as parameters into the HandleIncomingMessages() method on your SMSClient object.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.Port
member.summary: Local port to listen on.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.ServerSocket.IsListening
member.summary: Flag indicating wether socket is listening or not.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient
member.summary: SMS Client implementation for PSWinCom SMS Gateway

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. PrimaryGateway and SecondaryGateway will be default set to http://sms3.pswin.com/sms and http://sms3-backup.pswin.com/sms

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.SendMessagesBySocket(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends messages using socket protocol. NOTE! Send status and reference will not be updated when you use this method!
member.param: Host name of server you are sending to

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.SendMessages
member.summary: Send all messages in the Messages collection. This operation will block while communicating with the Gateway. After it has been completed, the Message objects in the Messages collection is updated with the Status, (and if applicable, also the Reference or FailedReason properties). If both PrimaryGateway and SecondaryGateway is specified, then the SendMessage() method will failover to SecondaryGateway if there is any communication exception from the main Gateway.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.HandleIncomingMessages(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads Xml from given stream and retrieves incoming messages or delivery reports within the XML document. The Messages or DeliveryReport are stored in the IncomingMessages or DeliveryReports collection.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.GetDocumentXml
member.summary: Build XmlDocument with messages to send.
member.returns: XmlDocument according to DTD for SMS Gateway

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.GetMessageXml(System.Xml.XmlDocument,PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.Message,System.Int32)
member.summary: Build Xml for a particular message

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.CreateElement(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a XmlElement with given name and value

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.CheckResponse(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Check response from Gateway, update Message collection with status

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.CheckRequest(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Check request for IncomingMessages/DeliveryReports from Gateway, update Message collection or DeliveryReport collection

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.GetNodeValue(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String)
member.summary: Return value of given node as by xpath expression, or null if not found
member.returns: Content of node as string or null if not found

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.HttpPost(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String)
member.summary: Send a HTTP Post request

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.Messages
member.summary: Collection of outgoing Message objects. Add your Message objects to this collection before sending the messages.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.ReceivedMessages
member.summary: Collection of incoming Message objects. This collection will contain the received messages after running HandleIncomingMessages. The collection is emptied by the HandleIncomingMessages() method.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.DeliveryReports
member.summary: Collection of received DeliveryReport objects. This collection will contain the received delivery reports after running HandleIncomingMessages. The collection is emptied by the HandleIncomingMessages() method.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.BatchSize
member.summary: Controls the size of batches sent to Gateway, defaults to 100. Set it to 0 or less to control batch size on your own.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.Username
member.summary: Username on SMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.Password
member.summary: Password on SMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.PrimaryGateway
member.summary: URL to PSWinCom SMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.SecondaryGateway
member.summary: Backup URL to PSWinCom SMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.SessionData
member.summary: SessionData. Leave empty if not required.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.AffiliateProgram
member.summary: Affiliate program identificator. Leave empty if not required.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.Proxy
member.summary: Set IWebProxy to be used when sending messages. Only required if you access internet through a Proxy.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSClient.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: Connect timeout value in seconds. If no response has been received within this time, SendMessages will try failover Gateway. If failover also times out it will exit. Default value is 10 seconds.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSException
member.summary: SMSException class for SMS Client related exceptions.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSException.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor taking string with error message as input

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.Client.SMSException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor taking string with error message and an inner exception as input
